fi.antiik.d3ciph3r.logic

Class CaesarCipher

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.antiik.d3ciph3r.logic.CaesarCipher

  • public class CaesarCipher
extends Object
    Also known as shift cipher. It's a type of substituion cipher where each letter in plaintext is replaced fixed number of positions down the alphabet.
    Author:
    janantik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CaesarCipher()
      if no shift is given, use the original 3 shift.
      CaesarCipher(int shift)
      shift is used to determinate the number of positions to be shifted.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String decrypt(String encryptedText, int shift)
      decrypts the data from param.
      String encrypt(String plaintext, int shift)
      Encrypt the data and return ciphered text.
      int getShift() 
      void setShift(int shift)
      shift cannot be negative, and if it's zero there is no point of (en/de)crypting.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaesarCipher

        public CaesarCipher(int shift)
        shift is used to determinate the number of positions to be shifted. If shift is negative it's multplied by one so correct shift is used. If the shift is zero whe use default shift, which is 3.
        Parameters:
        shift - number how many shift is needed in alphabets.

      • CaesarCipher

        public CaesarCipher()
        if no shift is given, use the original 3 shift.

    • Method Detail

      • getShift

        public int getShift()

      • setShift

        public void setShift(int shift)
        shift cannot be negative, and if it's zero there is no point of (en/de)crypting.
        Parameters:
        shift - new shift.

      • encrypt

        public String encrypt(String plaintext,
                      int shift)
        Encrypt the data and return ciphered text.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - plaintext to be encrypted.
        shift - shift used in encrypting.
        Returns:
        ciphered text.

      • decrypt

        public String decrypt(String encryptedText,
                      int shift)
        decrypts the data from param.
        Parameters:
        encryptedText - Encrypted text to be decrypted.
        shift - shift used in decrypting.
        Returns:
        plaintext of encrypted string.
